direction.raw_text: . ANOTHER STREET - DAY                                       66 The Grenada speeds up, heading towards the Police Station up ahead. The Bomb Squad Van appears and speeds up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Swan stands discreetly in a phone booth, watching as...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beard steers towards a parked Squad Car next to the Station - on collision course. At the last second, Beard dives from the moving car, hits the pavements and rolls. The Grenada CRASHES into the Squad Car... but no explosion. The Bomb Squad Van SKIDS to a stop as two uniformed Officers rush out of the Station. Beard has rolled to his feet and is now sprinting off down the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Pooch and T.J. jump out of the Van (leaving a BARKING Schnoz inside) and sprint towards the Grenada, guns drawn. Pooch is quickly huffing and puffing. T.J. continues after Beard as Pooch moves towards the Grenada. The uniforms follow T.J. Glass on his Harley appears from behind the Van. At the far end of the street the Studebaker rumbles into view, followed by a Squad Car, lights flashing. Everyone closing in on Beard. T.J. aims and yells at Beard. T.J. Police, freeze! Beard whirls around, SPRAYING automatic weapon FIRE at T.J. and the Uniforms - they hit the pavement. A few nearby Pedestrians SCREAM and drop to the ground. Reilly jumps out of his Studebaker as Beard turns his FIRE on him, BLOWING OUT his windshield. Back at the Grenada, Pooch ducks for cover by the open driver's door. Glass runs his Harley behind a parked car. The Squad Car behind Reilly SKIDS to a stop and as Beard shifts his aim, T.J. and Reilly each PUMP TWO SHOTS into Beard's torso. Beard spins around, drops - dead silence on the street. Relief all around. Everyone stands back up. T.J.'s jaw drops at the sight of actually having hit the suspect with his bullets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pooch exhales in relief, then hears BEEPING coming from the front seat of the car. He looks in to see the briefcase open, countdown ticking away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!! The Grenada explodes in a massive FIRE-BALL, throwing nearby Glass off his feet. Everyone else drops back to the ground, covering their heads.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - AT THE PHONE BOOTH Swan grins and walks away down an alley. We can hear the CRY of Schnoz, WAILING from the front seat of Van.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .   POLICE STATION - WINTERS' OFFICE - EARLY EVENING         67 Reilly stares off into space. Surreal silence, like a dream... Reilly looks at his watch, keeps his eyes low as he steals a glance at Glass in the other chair, face wracked with pain, loss. They both look through the glass office at the squad room outside, the sounds of reality fade in... phones ringing, voices shouting... a tense, chaotic emergency atmosphere. Reilly and Glass rise as Winters walks in, closes the door. He sits behind his desk, lights a cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reilly looks at Glass, there'll be no stepping in this time. He glares at Winters, reaches into his jacket, pulls out the badge and tosses it on Winter's desk. He pulls out his 9mm, pops out the clip and open the chamber, sets it down.

dialogue.raw_text: Glass, sorry about Pooch, he was a good man. We don't have time to give you a break right now, we're going ahead and-

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I promised her she'd be safe.

dialogue.raw_text: It won't work, he'll know it's a trap...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Reilly, you're done for now. What the hell were you thinking directing the Bomb Squad Team into hot pursuit. They had no business-

dialogue.raw_text: You've been at the center of two suspect fatalities and two Police Officer fatalities. I'll need your badge and your weapon.

direction.raw_text: . POLICE STATION - SQUAD ROOM - EARLY EVENING               68 Reilly and Glass trudge out, both profoundly disturbed as they head across the squad room. Glass veers off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reilly stares, eyes wet, watching him disappear. Glancing over, he notices Bev and T.J. sitting with Meg down the hall, Tommy and Janie asleep in her lap. Schnoz walks up to Meg, whimpering.   Bev wraps her arm around her. T.J. puts his hand on Bev's shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Pluchinsky brushes roughly past Reilly, snapping him out of it. He turns, walks dejectedly out. DISSOLVE TO:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .   POLICE STATION - REAR ENTRANCE - EARLY MORNING            69 An armored van screeches up. Doors fly open. Metro SWAT Team jumps out with equipment, helmets, rush into the building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .   POLICE STATION - SQUAD ROOM - MORNING                     70 Thundering silence. Winters and his men wait by phones. Their watches tick. So does the clock on the wall. Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Team Captain BENSON, huddles with his men. A phone rings, shattering the quiet.   Harry answers it, holds it up urgently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Winters takes it. A new high-tech TRACER flicks on a new piece of equipment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Swan's voice comes over the squawk box, growling low.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Tracer homes in on the signal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Click, dial tone. Winters flashes a look at the Tracer.   The Tracer yanks off his headphones in utter frustration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The room erupts into action. Benson and the SWAT Team are the first ones out the door...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You motherfuckers, you don't learn, do you?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have exactly thirty minutes to release the girl where you found her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How do we know you'll keep your word?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .   ALLEY - DAY                                              71 Hauntingly familiar. An unmarked police car pulls up and stops behind the machine shop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ./INT. ALLEY - CAR                                           72 Harry sits behind the wheel.    Mary sits in the back, handcuffed to Pluchinsky. Pluchinsky unlocks the cuffs.   Mary's eyes flare
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary steps out of the car. She glances around--then heads in the opposite direction of the Machine Shop. Pluchinsky curses. He starts to go after her, but realizes he'd better clear the area. He peals out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Get out and go to the machine shop -
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . STREET - DAY                                               73 Undercover Men in various disguises track her from cars, and on foot, communicating by hidden mics. A WINO eyes her carefully, lifts a bottle to his mouth and whispers...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary exits the alley onto the street, searching where to go. She turns down the street and moves fast, eyes darting about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STREET                                                     74 The SWAT van is tucked into an alley...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Winters, Benson and Team monitor the radio communication.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.C.) (on the radio) Position Four. Turning on Elm.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ELM STREET - DAY                                           75 Mary crosses the street, a Camero nearly clips her. She makes it safely to the sidewalk and passes a TRUCK DRIVER eating a hot dog. After she moves off...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Mary looks around quickly, blends into a crowd coming out of a store and ducks inside.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (speaks into sleave) Six.   She's crossing to Main.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont.) She just went into a department store.    She's out of sight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Winters grabs the mic...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The SWAT van RUMBLES to life.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Seal the building! (to Benson) Let's move.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DEPARTMENT STORE - DAY                                       77 Mary bolts through the store, ducks through a service door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DEPARTMENT STORE - SERVICE ENTRANCE - ALLEY - DAY            78 Mary bursts out, runs like a spooked horse. As she dashes to the mouth of the the alley, she runs smack into the Camaro that almost hit her. It SCREECHES to a stop. The passenger door flies open. Mary leans down and looks in, flushes. It's Swan.    He reaches over and yanks her inside, TEARS away. The Truck Driver runs into the other end of the alley. He starts to give chase as Swan tosses a small package out of the car. The Truck Driver dives for cover as...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!!   A dumpster EXPLODES.   The Truck Driver jumps to his feet...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into sleave) We have contact. Black Camaro-
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Van SPEEDS up as we hear...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CITY STREETS - DAY                                         80 From every direction, unmarked cars, squad units and the SWAT Van converge on the area.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .   CAMARO - MOVING                                          81 Swan drives with deadly confidence, glances at Mary tenderly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He swerves left, then right, pulling a transmitter out of his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He sets a dial to 10, pushes a button. The transmitter counts down... 9, 8, 7...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ALLEY - DAY                                               82 The Camaro tears down a one-way alley going the wrong way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Undercover vehicles race after the Camero, seconds behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... They swerve into the alley. Then just as Swan whooshes out, a charge EXPLODES a stack of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gallon drums. They fall down into the path of the pursuers who crash into the FLAMING DRUMS. The lead car EXPLODES...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ./INT. STREET - CAMERO - MOVING - DAY                       83 Mary looks back in horror as she's whisked away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .   DOWNTOWN BAR - DAY                                      84 Dark, filthy, last stop to nowhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .   BACK HALLWAY                                            85 Drunk, dejected, looking like shit, Reilly waits for a fix with a couple other JUNKIES. The TV in the bar drones in the background. The Dealer appears and gestures to Reilly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reilly trudges over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Reilly looks up sharply as he hears the TV, visible through the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something clears behind Reilly' eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reilly's eyes shift, mind racing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly himself again, Reilly bolts up, sending the Dealer and his equipment scattering, and streaks off. He bursts out of the front door of the bar into the glare of sunlight... we can hear SIRENS not too far off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, what's it gonna be? I got China White, Snow Flake, Ivory Pearl...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're coming to you live near the scene of that latest, explosion that ripped through a downtown alley less than half an hour ago.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Despite growing fears and talk of a coverup, police have sealed off the area and are refusing to comment about fatalities, or the rumor that terrorists may be involved.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .   STUDEBAKER - MOVING - DAY                                86 Driving like a maniac as usual, Reilly grabs the radio mike with one hand, pulls his back-up .357 out of the glove-box. He listens out the window for the SIRENS, he looks up at the sound of approaching HELICOPTERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .   GAS STATION - DAY                                        87 In the service bay, a MECHANIC raises the black Camaro on a hydraulic lift, out of sight from the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Out front, Swan pays an ATTENDANT, climbs into an orange U- Haul truck with Mary, drives off. A beat, a squad car and an unmarked speed past the Gas Station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ./INT.   STREETS - U-HAUL - MOVING                          88 Swan brushes Mary's hair from her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary shakes her head, scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She forces a smile. Swan frowns suspiciously as he turns down a service road, pulls into...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You hungry?     We could get something to eat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SELF-STORAGE WAREHOUSE - DAY                              89 Swan pulls up to the loading dock of the warehouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are we stopping here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary turns white.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alex, please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay in the truck. He gets out, disappears into the building. Mary glances around desperately, sees a phone booth at the corner. She looks back at the warehouse, the phone again, terrified.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We're moving' on. I have to pick up the supplies. Just two little boxes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Yanking her door open, Mary dashes to the booth, searches her pockets. Empty. She dials zero... it rings and rings, then finally...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Operator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get me the police!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this an emergency?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes! Please, hurry! Mary's back is to the warehouse as she waits forever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Police, Sergeant Doyle speaking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, I need help, my name is--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoa, slow down, lady. Now what's that again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Suddenly Mary sees the reflection of a face in the phone booth glass. She whirls - Swan is standing behind her!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you calling, sis?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?    Nobody, I- She tries to hang up.   Swan grabs the receiver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alex, please-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up! (into phone) Who is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sergeant Doyle, Metro P.D. Look, what's going on--? Swan's eyes turn cold, SLAMS down the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help! Swan grabs Mary, dragging her with him.   A pair of TEENAGE BOYS on skateboards notice, veer over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey--? Swan whips out his Mac-11. The Boys skate for cover as Swan drags Mary back to the U-Haul. The open back door reveals a number of 55 gallon drums, some boxes and two milk crates of C4. He SLAMS down the sliding door, moves around front and shoves Mary inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .   STUDEBAKER - MOVING - DAY                                90 Caught in traffic, map spread out in his lap, Reilly slams on his horn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His police radio crackles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reilly perks up, checks his map. Jamming the wheel, he crashes out of traffic, ripping the bumper off the car in front of him, and rockets away. He grabs his mic, thinks, disguises his voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reilly runs a red.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . T.J.'S VOICE T.J. here.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: All units, 211 reported at 8th and Sycamore. Suspect is a Caucasian male, armed with an automatic weapon, last seen heading east with female hostage in a U-Haul truck ...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Patch me through to the Bomb Squad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ./INT. STREET - BOMB SQUAD VAN - MOVING - DAY            91 T.J. is in the passenger seat, Bev sits in the back with Schnoz, Glass drives. Glass takes the mic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where you guys at?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Reilly hangs up, fishtails around a corner, map blowing out the window.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Catch that alert? That's him in the U-Haul.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cuz he got the girl, now he's leaving town.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Should we head for the Interstate?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I'd slip out past the hotel district, behind Greyhound...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . STREETS - DAY                                             92 Patrol cars, unmarked and the SWAT Van criss-cross the streets in confusion...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ANOTHER STREET - DAY                                      93 T.J. speeds by in the Bomb Squad van.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .   STUDEBAKER - MOVING - DAY                               94 Reilly swerves onto 8th Street, eyes searching desperately. Rounding the rear of a huge glass luxury hotel, Reilly catches a glimpse of orange disappear around a corner. Reilly bangs a hard right to go around the block.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into mic) Glass, Eighth Street, alley behind Grand Hotel. Cut him off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ANOTHER STREET - DAY                                      95 The Bomb Squad accelerates...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .   STUDEBAKER - MOVING - DAY                               96 Reilly changes channels on the radio...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into mic) All units, suspect spotted heading down alley behind Grand Hotel. (MORE)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ./INT. STREET - SWAT VAN - MOVING - DAY                      97 Winters is shocked at the sound of Reilly's voice.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into mic) Reilly, what the hell are you-?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.C.) (on radio) Fire me later. Close in and we got the bastard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pull back.   You're only an observer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ./INT. STREET - STUDEBAKER - MOVING - DAY                    98 Reilly throws down his mic, aims at the alley ahead and speeds up, then cranks into the alley, SCREECHES to a stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ALLEY - DAY                                                99 The U-Haul barrels down the alley. Swan sees Reilly up ahead get out of his car and aim his .357 Swan SLAMS on the brakes. Throws the vehicle into reverse. Checks his mirror to see the Bomb Squad Van appear at the end of the alley. He's completely pinned in. Glass and T.J. jump out, they are in bullet-proof vest, aiming shotguns, using the van as a shield. Bev jumps out with Schnoz and slips behind the van entirely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reilly's radio CRACKLES...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll keep him pinned in, you guys hurry up! Reilly throws done the mic, takes aim again.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.C.) Reilly, what's happening? Reilly! Reilly! Do not engage. We're five minutes-
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: idles.   Swan's rage erupts.       He climbs out with Mary in tow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reilly aims carefully... Swan keeps his Mac-11 to Mary's head. Reilly is frozen by the move. Swan backs to the rear of the van. He slides up the door, revealing the drums and explosives to the Bomb Squad. He reaches in and grabs a remote control.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: are coming closer, only a block or two away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Glass and T.J. drop their jaws.       They see Swan depress the remote, arming the explosives. T.J. Jesus...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reilly!    He's loaded!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (yelling) Glass, you guys take cover, goddammit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want out, right now.      Or the whole city block is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reilly, he's got enough to do it. Reilly leaves the cover of his car and scurries along the side of the alley, escaping Swan's view. Swan rages.   He moves around the van, pulling Mary along. Swan SPRAYS a FLURRY of bullets over Reilly's head... Reilly dives for cover as bullets rip the alley wall inches from his face. Swan whirls and SPRAYS the Bomb Squad Van, dropping T.J. with a shot to the leg. Bev drops to his aid. Glass grimaces, having been hit in the shoulder. Reilly moves forward about to take the shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reilly, don't. He's got a pressure switch. He releases it, we're done for. Swan turns back to Reilly, rams his Mac-11 to her throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drop it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take him! Mary jerks away from Swan. Reilly fast FIRES. Swan takes Reilly's SHOTS in the chest. He smiles as he starts to fall, his hand starts to open up to release the detonator... Mary dives onto Swan and grabs at the remote, clasping it in her hands. Swan collapses, Mary on top of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Reilly and Glass sprint at the U-Haul, reaching a trembling, bleeding Mary. She clinches her jaw, fighting the grief, holding on to the remote. Reilly reaches Mary first and puts his hands over her's - she looks up into his eyes--distraught.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold on to that thing tight. Glass goes to the explosives and looks over the set-up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus Fucking H. Christ... Reilly has never heard Glass swear before...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck factor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Off the scale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do we do? Glass turns to Mary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you hold it? She nods.   Reilly releases her gently, joining Glass at the van.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Talk to me.     Let's assess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Glass stares at the digital read-out on the device anchored in one of the C4 crates. It reads: "1:30, 1:29..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon, talk to me! We can do it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He has a timer going as back-up, in case we got a hold of the remote. (beat) Okay... first, run your fingers along the edges, feel for a sensor. Reilly does it the way he saw Glass do it before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good, now the other side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, let's go in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: :18, 1:17, 1:16 .... Reilly feels around, finally finds an access hole. Reilly works the hole bigger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not enough time ... gotta go for the blasting cap. Only one chance... hand entry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep talking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Close your eyes, feel your fingertips.   Tell me everything you feel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Reilly' hand disappears into the hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -UP - INSIDE THE BOMB His fingers snake through complex circuitry as he describes each layer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wires... metal, cold... something soft...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't touch that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The red digital numbers keep counting down: 0:38, 0:37, 0:36
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More metal... sharp edge...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay to your left. Deeper, deeper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The SWAT Van and a unit arrive, Winters and Benson jump out, the SWAT Team is about to follow- T.J. Get outta here, Swan's down, but they're chilling a device. Winters looks to the action at the U-Haul, sees Reilly and Glass busy at work. He nods at Benson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: :30, 0:29, 0:28... Finally Reilly' fingers touch a button object. We hear the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Van and the unit retreat at the end of the alley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something round, two wires ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the blasting cap - good! Okay, now grab it by the base and pull it straight up. No, Wait...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too easy. There's gotta be something else in there, another cap maybe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make up your mind, trigger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ease your thumb over to the right - feel anything? Reilly eyes shift as his hidden fingers feel around...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, another round thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, one of the caps turns it on, the other shuts it down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which one's which?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What... ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When in doubt, pull the yellow wire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How the hell do you feel yellow?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No excuses, just do it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Reilly glares at Glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... His face is dripping with sweat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... His fingers shift back to the first cap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... They close over it, ready to pull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... But then they stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Reilly frowns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Glass stabs him with a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... 2... Lightning-quick, Reilly' fingers fly back and yank the second cap out of its base. The counter stops.    0:01. Reilly and Glass and stare at it, holding their breath, hardly daring to believe it's true. They whoop and explode with relief. It's over... it's finally over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not bad, for a rookie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. Reilly and Glass turn to Mary who has lost consciousness but is still holding the remote tightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Glass looks up to see T.J. and Bev peeking from around their van.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bev jumps into the van to make the call as T.J. starts limping towards the U-Haul. Schnoz yelps and drops from the van and runs for the U-Haul. Reilly cradles Mary in his lap as Glass kneels and removes the remote - the red light stops flashing, then turns off. T.J. arrives and looks down at Reilly and Mary, then at the device in the U-Haul. T.J. Nice work.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: All clear, but we need an ambulance!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . POLICE STATION -SQUAD ROOM - DAY                          100 The room is back to its usual bustling activity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . POLICE STATION - WINTER'S OFFICE - DAY                    101 Winters is going through reports on his desk as Reilly enters. Reilly is cleaned up, shaven, haircut, new suit... a new man. Winters look up, impressed with the change.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Winters hands Reilly an envelope and a new badge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Winters nods and goes back to his paperwork.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont.) Just want you wanted. Your promotion, and transfer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . THE CAVE - DAY                                             102 T.J. and Bev work closely together on a mock-device. T.J. is teaching her the job. They smile warmly at each other. Glass is on the computer. Reilly enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: T.J. flinches, but she winks at him to calm him down.    T.J. smiles... no longer threatened. Glass doesn't look up from his computer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Glass points to the work station next to him where a Bomb Squad Protocol Program is waiting on the screen. Reilly smiles and he sits next to Glass, hands him the transfer papers envelope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Glass accepts the papers and shakes Reilly's hand.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Nice to be here. T.J. That feeling won't last long.
dialogue.name: dialogue
